"A typical phishing attack usually entails scammers sending fake emails to a high number " "of people with the aim of tricking users into giving their personal information (usually bank details). " "The email may contains malicious attachments that can result in the computer being infected with malware, " "or links that redirect the user to dangerous websites. 

" "Phishing emails are becoming harder to spot. The usual signs of spotting phishing emails is by looking at " "the sender email address, spelling mistakes, suspicious requests of personal information, and links that " "direct the user to non-authentic websites. The resources provided will help you in understanding the dangers " "and signs of a phishing attack.

"
"Phishing video – Everyday 8 million people open a fraudulent phishing email. This short video will " "show you an example of a fraudulent email, with tips on how to avoid falling victim. \n"

"Spear phishing – Spear phishing is like Phishing but is targeted towards a specific individual. " "The attacker may have studied someone to obtain certain information to target them. This video " "will show you an example of this and methods to prevent falling victim. \n"
"A general overview of phishing attacks and methods of preventing them from occurring \n"

"Avoiding phishing attacks: This guidance is beneficial for businesses and general computer " "users to read to understand various aspects of phishing attacks. This includes general information, " "tips for minimising the damage of a successful phishing attack, and signs for spotting an attack. \n"
